an8.69:1.3: The assemblies of aristocrats, brahmins, householders, and ascetics. An assembly of the gods under the Four Great Kings. An assembly of the gods under the Thirty-Three. An assembly of Māras. An assembly of Brahmās.
an8.69:1.4: I recall having approached an assembly of hundreds of aristocrats.
an8.69:1.5: There I used to sit with them, converse, and engage in discussion.
an8.69:1.6: And my appearance and voice became just like theirs.
an8.69:1.7: I educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired them with a Dhamma talk.
an8.69:1.8: But when I spoke they didn’t know:
an8.69:1.9: ‘Who is this that speaks? Is it a god or a human?’
an8.69:1.10: And when my Dhamma talk was finished I vanished.
an8.69:1.11: But when I vanished they didn’t know:
an8.69:1.12: ‘Who was that who vanished? Was it a god or a human?’
an8.69:2.1: I recall having approached an assembly of hundreds of brahmins …
an8.69:2.4: the gods under the Four Great Kings …
an8.69:2.8: There too I used to sit with them, converse, and engage in discussion.
an8.69:2.9: And my appearance and voice became just like theirs.
an8.69:2.10: I educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired them with a Dhamma talk.
an8.69:2.11: But when I spoke they didn’t know:
an8.69:2.12: ‘Who is this that speaks? Is it a god or a human?’
an8.69:2.13: And when my Dhamma talk was finished I vanished.
an8.69:2.14: But when I vanished they didn’t know:
an8.69:2.15: ‘Who was that who vanished? Was it a god or a human?’
